candidates.title: Support for friendly_json comment
candidates.body:
This will enable the parsing of a flat json marked as `friendly_json`. 

This will also:

* Migrate from `failure` to `this_error`.
* Updated references

This will close #54.

candidates.title: Bugfix: comments no longer remove friendly names
Added optional sudo to wg command
Support for # key values in comment (friendly_name at the moment)
Multiple interfaces from command line support
Split interface name from peer configuration file
candidates.body:
# Breaking change

Solves https://github.com/MindFlavor/prometheus_wireguard_exporter/issues/22.

This PR adds a `-i` command line parameter that specifies the interface name. Previously it was inferred from the configuration file. If you were using the `-n` flag, please specify the `-i` flag as well to keep the same behaviour.

candidates.title: Support for stderr output in TRACE log level
support for ipv6 address in command line
candidates.body:
This PR allows the service to listen to IPv6 addresses as well as IPv4.

Addresses https://github.com/MindFlavor/prometheus_wireguard_exporter/issues/23.

candidates.title: Strip link-local zone ids from IPv6 socket addrs
candidates.body:
:warning: **Caution:** this is just a workaround, not a fix for #10. It may help others who encounter this as well, but I'm **not** sure if we really want to merge and release this patch.

-----

This is a fairly ugly hack to temporarily work around the issue #10.
Until now Rust doesn't support so-called zone-ids[1] in link-local IPv6
socket-addresses and has a pending RFC on this topic. As I'm
encountering this issue on one of my machines I decided to work around
this issue (for now) by removing the zone-id from the IPv6 address.

This won't harm any other cases as `regex.replace_all` simply returns
the input if the regex doesn't match:

```
>> extern crate regex;
>> let re = regex::Regex::new(r"^\[(?P<ip>[A-Fa-f0-9:]+)%(.*)\]:(?P<port>[0-9]+)$");
>> let rs = re.replace_all("fairly unrelated stuff", "[$ip]:$port");
>> rs
"fairly unrelated stuff"
```

Please note that (1) this regex isn't RFC-compliant[2] and is just a
heuristic to remove zone-ids that currently break this exporter and
(2) this is something that probably shouldn't be merged as-is. I mainly
pushed this since I needed a workaround for this issue (and others
probably too), but it may be better to wait for proper support from the
language.

[1] https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4007#section-11

candidates.title: wg show <interface> if specified in the command line
Export remote information behind optional flag
Replaced local_ip + local_port with allowed_ips
candidates.body:
Solves [https://github.com/MindFlavor/prometheus_wireguard_exporter/issues/8](https://github.com/MindFlavor/prometheus_wireguard_exporter/issues/8). Unfortunately this means the Prometheus' labels will have to change. Specifically:

`local_ip` and 'local_port` are replaced by `allowed_ips`. `allowed_ips` is not interpreted in any way: we just pass on the value returned by WireGuard.

candidates.title: Added Travis integration and fixed failing tests
Counters ending in `_total` and timestamps are not interpreted as delta
Friendly names support for peer names

chosen_pr.title: Support for friendly_json comment
chosen_pr.body:
This will enable the parsing of a flat json marked as `friendly_json`. 

This will also:

* Migrate from `failure` to `this_error`.
* Updated references

This will close #54.
